title: Wrapper Extensions​
content: A wrapper extension 'wraps' a core extension. They are defined in YAML and reside in the detc-resources repository. The purpose of wrapper extension is to package some code into a re-usable unit called in a step. For example, the EKS extension is actually a wrapper extension that uses the Terraform extension to deploy EKS. Common use cases can be created as wrapper extensions and simplify their re-use.

title: Example Usage​
content: --- example: steps: - name: instance extension: AzureCompute tags: infra args: region: !secret azure.region instance_name: "my-instance" Copy

title: instance_name​
content: Required	true Type	string Determine what to call this new compute instance.

title: region​
content: Required	true Type	string Set the Azure location to use.

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptionip	string	the public ip of the new instance ssh_key	string	The SSH private key for connecting to the new instance

title: Example Usage​
content: --- example: steps: - name: vpc extension: VPC.AWS tags: infrastructure args: name: "new-vpc" - name: instance extension: EC2Instance tags: infra needs: - vpc args: vpc_id: !lookup /vpc/outputs/vpc_id subnet: !lookup /vpc/outputs/subnet_id1 instance_name: "new-instance" Copy

title: instance_name​
content: Required	true Type	string Determine what to call this new compute instance.

title: vpc_id​
content: Required	true Type	string Set the AWS VPC ID to use.

title: subnet​
content: Required	true Type	string Set the AWS subnet ID to use.

title: ports​
content: Required	false Type	string Set the ports to expose on the public IP (comma separated).

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptionip	string	the public ip of the new instance pem	string	The SSH private key for connecting to the new instance public_key	string	The SSH public_key in the authorized_keys file sg_id	string	The AWS security-group that is assigned to the node instance_id	string	the ID of the new AWS instance keypair	string	the name of the keypair assigned to the instance private_ip	string	the private IP address of the new instance

title: Example Usage​
content: --- example: steps: - name: new-vpc extension: VPC.AWS tags: infrastructure args: name: "new-vpc" Copy

title: name​
content: Required	true Type	string Determine what to call this new VPC.

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptionvpc_id	string	id of the new vpc subnet_id1	string	id of the first subnet, in region's availability zone a subnet_id2	string	id of the second subnet, in region's availability zone b

title: Example Usage​
content: --- example: steps: - name: instance extension: GCPCompute args: region: !secret gcp.region project: !secret gcp.project_id instance_name: "example-instance" Copy

title: instance_name​
content: Required	true Type	string Determine what to call this new compute instance.

title: region​
content: Required	true Type	string Set the GCP region to use.

title: project​
content: Required	true Type	string Set the GCP project to use.

title: tags​
content: Required	false Type	string Set the GCP tags to assign (comma separated).

title: instance_size​
content: Required	false Type	string Default	e2-small Set the GCP compute instance size to use.

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptionip	string	the public ip of the new instance ssh_key	string	The SSH private key for connecting to the new instance

title: Example Usage​
content: --- aws-k8s: steps: - name: k8s extension: EKS args: region: !secret aws.region deployment_name: sharedeks Copy

title: region​
content: Required	true Type	string Define which AWS region to build the resources in.

title: deployment_name​
content: Required	true Type	string What should the new deployment be called (the cluster is named using this argument).

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptioncluster_id	string	id of the cluster created cluster_arn	string	ARN of the created cluster cluster_endpoint	string	URL for the K8s API cluster_security_group_id	string	name of the security group the control traffic in the clsuter kubectl_config	string	kubectl configuration file config_map_aws_auth	string	configuration map for IAM roles (see docs) cluster_name	string	friendly name of the cluster created vpc_id	string	vpc ID created for the cluster public_subnet_id	string	subnet id of the public subnet created private_subnet_id	string	subnet id of the private subnet created region	string	region that the cluster was created in cluster_worker_security_group_id	string	security group that the worker nodes reside

title: Example Usage​
content: --- azure-k8s: steps: - name: k8s extension: AKS args: deployment_name: sharedaks azure_app_id: !secret azure.app_id azure_password: !secret azure.password azure_subscription_id: !secret azure.subscription_id azure_tenant_id: !secret azure.tenant_id azure_location: !secret azure.region Copy

title: azure_app_id​
content: Required	true Type	string The application registration ID to use when creating the new cluster

title: azure_password​
content: Required	true Type	string The application registration password to use when creating the new cluster

title: azure_subscription_id​
content: Required	true Type	string The Azure subscription ID to create the new resource in

title: azure_tenant_id​
content: Required	true Type	string The Azure tenant ID to create the new resource in

title: azure_location​
content: Required	true Type	string Define which Azure region to build the resources in.

title: deployment_name​
content: Required	true Type	string What should the new deployment be called (the cluster is named using this argument).

title: instance_size​
content: Required	false Type	string The Azure compute machine size to use.

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptioncluster_id	string	id of the cluster created cluster_name	string	friendly name of the cluster created cluster_endpoint	string	URL for the K8s API kubectl_config	string	kubectl configuration file resource_group_name	string	the Azure resource group the cluster was created in

title: Plans
content: Plans For generic documentation about what a plan is, please review the documentation in the detc project here. For each plan in the catalog, please review its documentation. Some plans are deployed as standalone, while others rely on a combination of plans (that can be deployed simultaneously).

title: Detailed, step by step documentation​
content: All detc plans can be reviewed via the --preview flag. For all the commands listed below, replace --apply with --preview to get more details. tip You may want to increase verbosity via --verbose or even --trace to get all details you may want from the preview command.

title: Azure​
content: Note: Requires the AKS plan to be deployed detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/k8s/aks.yaml \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-demo/unhackable-ecommerce-app/main/deploy/ecommerce-aks.yaml \ --apply Copy

title: AWS​
content: Note: Requires the EKS plan to be deployed detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-demo/unhackable-ecommerce-app/main/deploy/ecommerce-eks.yaml \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/k8s/eks.yaml \ --apply Copy

title: Outputs​
content: Review the step outputs via detc deployments. The URL for the application can be found in the ecommerce step, named frontend_app_url.

title: Example Usage​
content: --- gcp-k8s: steps: - name: k8s extension: GKE tags: infrastructure args: region: !secret gcp.region project: !secret gcp.project_id cluster_name: sharedgke Copy

title: region​
content: Required	true Type	string Define which GCP region to build the resources in.

title: project​
content: Required	true Type	string Define which GCP project to build the resources in.

title: cluster_name​
content: Required	true Type	string What should the new GKE clsuter be called.

title: Outputs​
content: Name	Type	Descriptioncluster_endpoint	string	URL for the K8s API kubectl_config	string	kubectl configuration file cluster_ca_certificate	string	CA cert details used by the cluster cluster_name	string	friendly name of the cluster created network	string	the network created for this new cluster subnet	string	the subnet created for this new cluster

title: Detailed, step by step documentation​
content: All detc plans can be reviewed via the --preview flag. For all the commands listed below, replace --apply with --preview to get more details. tip You may want to increase verbosity via --verbose or even --trace to get all details you may want from the preview command.

title: Plan Launch Commands​
content: detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/reverse-shell-simulation.yml \ --apply Copy

title: Outputs​
content: Review the step outputs via detc deployments. The URL for the application can be found in the reverseshell-nodeapp step, named app_url.

title: Detailed, step by step documentation​
content: All detc plans can be reviewed via the --preview flag. For all the commands listed below, replace --apply with --preview to get more details. tip You may want to increase verbosity via --verbose or even --trace to get all details you may want from the preview command.

title: GCP​
content: Note: Requires the GKE plan to be deployed detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/k8s/gke.yaml \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/bankofanthos/gke.yml \ --apply Copy

title: Outputs​
content: Review the step outputs via detc deployments. The URL for the application can be found in the deploy-boa step, named app_url.

title: Required secrets​
content: lacework.access_token: An access token must be supplied, and this is used when instrumenting the compute instances involved in the ticketing application.

title: Detailed, step by step documentation​
content: All detc plans can be reviewed via the --preview flag. For all the commands listed below, replace --apply with --preview to get more details. tip You may want to increase verbosity via --verbose or even --trace to get all details you may want from the preview command.

title: GCP​
content: Note: Requires the GKE plan to be deployed detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/k8s/gke.yaml \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/voteapp/voteapp-gke.yml \ --apply Copy

title: Azure​
content: Note: Requires the AKS plan to be deployed detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/k8s/aks.yaml \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/voteapp/voteapp-aks.yml \ --apply Copy

title: AWS​
content: Note: Requires the EKS plan to be deployed detc create \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/voteapp/voteapp-eks.yml \ --plan https://raw.githubusercontent.com/lacework-dev/detc-resources/main/plans/k8s/eks.yaml \ --apply Copy

title: Outputs​
content: Review the step outputs via detc deployments. The URL for both the voteapp and resultapp can be found in the voteapp steps outputs.

title: Required Secrets​
content: lacework.accss_token: Access token to use on the deployed workloads lacework.account_name: Account name to store in Jenkins secret jenkins.admin_id: User name for the admin user jenkins.admin_pass: Password for the Jenkins admin user dockerhub.user: Dockerhub username for Jenkins secret dockerhub.token: Dockerhub access token for Jenkins secret NOTE: For Jenkins deployment, your local detc configuration must contain Azure, GCP, and AWS credentials or the deployment is not successful. These cloud credentials are made available in the Jenkins instance

title: Detailed, step by step documentation​
content: All detc plans can be reviewed via the --preview flag. For all the commands listed below, replace --apply with --preview to get more details. tip You may want to increase verbosity via --verbose or even --trace to get all details you may want from the preview command.
